title: How to Build Arm Strength Without Equipment

steps.title: Do some pushups.
steps.content: Do some pushups. These will help you to build upper arm strength. Just do them in moderation, and keep it in daily motions. [1] X Research source [2] X Expert Source Alex Robles, MD, NASM Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 30 July 2021. You can try a variety of different push-ups, like incline, decline, wide-grip, close-grip, and pseudo plank. [3] X Expert Source Alex Robles, MD, NASM Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 30 July 2021. You can also try a pike push-up, which is a scaled-back version of a handstand push-up. [4] X Expert Source Alex Robles, MD, NASM Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 30 July 2021.

steps.title: Incorporate simple cardio.
steps.content: Incorporate simple cardio. Just throw in one or two 15-20 minute jogs or something similar every or every other day. Getting your muscles and body fit as well will help you to get upper arm strength much easier.

steps.title: Do sit-ups.
steps.content: Do sit-ups. They will help your stomach to get toned and make it easier when you're working on building upper arm strength, through exercises such as push-ups.

steps.title: Try simple arm tricks.
steps.content: Try simple arm tricks. You can use some tricks such as holding a full roll of duck-tape in one hand, with your arm out-stretched until you can't hold it anymore. This tip is highly recommended by the Navy.

steps.title: Include physical activity in your daily regime.
steps.content: Include physical activity in your daily regime. This will help you all-around get in shape, which will, in the end, make strengthening your upper muscles quite easier. steps.title: Do arm circles.
steps.content: Do arm circles. Hold your arms out in a straight horizontal line. Rotate them in small circles, or for a harder exercise, make the circles larger. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Do goalpost punchers.
steps.content: Do goalpost punchers. Have each arm form a ninety degree angle, facing upwards. Then, flip them upside down and straighten them out. Repeat, making the motions as quick as possible. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Do shoulder pulses.
steps.content: Do shoulder pulses. Hold your arms out in a straight horizontal line and jerk them up very slightly, then back down. Repeat. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Do back behinds.
steps.content: Do back behinds. Hold your arms out in a straight horizontal line. Pull them in so they form an upside down triangle, making sure your biceps are slightly behind your back. Repeat.

steps.title: Do triangle pushes.
steps.content: Do triangle pushes. Place your arms in a position where when put together, they make a long triangle. Push them out so they are straight in front of you and parallel. Repeat. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Do prayer pulses.
steps.content: Do prayer pulses. Put your hands and arms in a straight, vertical position so they are pressed against one another and shoulder level. Raise them up, then lower to shoulder level. Repeat.
